page.title: 18WOODROW HIGH HOUSE
page.content: Woodrow High House was given to the London Federation of Boys Clubs by the worshipful company of Goldsmiths in 1946. The house dates back to about 1656, and originally belonged to the Drake family of Shardeloes. Once Oliver Cromwell's wife and daughter lived here. It is used mainly as a training centre and is now run by Mr Hickman (Sarah Hickman is in our class.)Mid-week schools,adult groups etc come,usually running their own courses,and week-ends boys clubs come. In the grounds are some of the rarest plants in England,especially the weeping beech.There is a swimming pool gymnasium,football pitch,tennis courts and assault course.There have been many famous visitors,like the English Olympic boxing team,English football team,Bobby Robson and the Duke of Edinburgh.
